greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of increasing sequences of n positive integers with reciprocals adding up to k (k=1,2,...,A055980(n)).
comment: Conjecture: for n in A115515 (i.e., A055980(n+1)=A055980(n)+1), the sequences being enumerated by T(n,A055980(n)) must start with 1. E.g., there is no 10-tuple (x_1,x_2,...,x_10) with 1 < x_1 < ... < x_10 and 1/x_1 + ... + 1/x_10 = 2 (=A055980(10)).
xref: Cf. A280518 (row sums), A006585 (column k=1), A156869 (nondecreasing sequences), A280519 (ordered sequences).
results.author: _Max Alekseyev_, Jan 04 2017
